home.content:
# Lecture 13+14: Objects, Arrays and jQuery --- Welcome to lectures 13 and 14! Here's a brief rundown #### Useful Class Links --- ##### [LAST LECTURE: LIVE Instructor View](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD113_JS_Conditionals)

##### [TODAY: JS Global Notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD629_JS_Basics) | [LIVE Instructor View](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD629_JS_Basics)

#### Learning Objectives --- 1. What are objects? How are they useful in programming? 2. What are arrays? How are they useful in programming? 3. What is jQuery? How do the principles of programming learned thus far help us understand and use jQuery to build UIs? #### Rundown --- #### [Warmup](#warmup) #### [Objects](#objects) #### [Arrays](#arrays) #### [jQuery](#jQuery)

warmup.content:
# Warmup --- Before we begin, let's do a practice problem. #### Exercise --- #### [Implement Rock, Paper, Scissors Game](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD_113_Conditionals_RPS)

#### Details --- 1. We are **only** concerned with the **algorithm** that is necessary for computing the winner. 2. Later on, we will figure out how to wire up a UI for this particular function...

objects.content:
# Objects --- Here are some practice problems regarding objects. #### PSETS --- #### [Problems 47-50: Objects](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD_629_functions_pset_9) | [LIVE class notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/FEWD_629_functions_pset_9)

#### Notes --- Here's how we would create objects ```js const Cat = { name: 'Annabelle Lee', } ```

arrays.content:
# Arrays --- Here are some practice problems regarding arrays. #### PSETS --- #### [Array PSET](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/Arrays_PSET) | [LIVE class notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#broadcast/mottaquikarim/Arrays_PSET) #### [Shopping List](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD629_JavaScript_Shopping_List) | [LIVE class notes](http://samantha.fewd.us/#fork/mottaquikarim/FEWD629_JavaScript_Shopping_List)

#### Notes --- Here's how we would create arrays ```js const grads = [1,2,3,4]; ```
